author: James Lyons-Weiler

comments.message: In the US, companies carry out studies if they think they have a drug that is effective for a specific indication, and FDA then reviews the studies. If companies think they have a drug that will be effective against Ebola, they are probably considering the logistics of carrying out a study. Perhaps we need to learn more about how scientists match an anti-viral to a virus.

description: The activity of antiviral medicines are varied and targeted at specific molecular targets.  In the case of last-resort care, it seems wasteful of human life to not test all known antivirals.
summary: US Federal Government claim, under imminent domain precedent, the rights to try all antiviral medicines on the shelves of all US Pharmaceuticals on patients who test positive for Ebola.  Distribute the drugs to hotzones.  Establish a simple field testing and reporting protocol to the FDA, NIH/NIAID and the NIH.
title: Mandate Immediate Field Testing of All Antiviral Medicines
